I usually play with the hard mode rules, but I've stopped bothering in situations like this. It takes more strategy to find a word that eliminates multiple possibilities than it does to just brute-force guesses.,9,3,"['stare', 'pinch', 'scare']",scare,5

The 6 words remaining after >!COULD!< all start with  the same 3 letters. Guessing >!CHEEK!<, if it's wrong, can eliminate 2 other possible words, >!CHEEP!< and >!CHECK!<. Guessing >!CHEEP!< or >!CHECK!< can only eliminate >!CHEEK!<, and guessing any of the other words can only eliminate that word.,9,5,"['arise', 'could', 'chewy', 'check', 'cheek']",cheek,7

1. ⬜️🟩⬜️🟩⬜️ >!AROSE!< (Starting word)
2. ⬜️⬜️⬜️🟨⬜️ >!TULIP!< (2nd word when starting word has no vowels)
3. ⬜️⬜️🟩⬜️🟩 >!CHINK!< (Guess position of >!I!<, for which I thought the middle letter was most likely, plus 4 more letters.)
4. 🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩 >!BRISK!< (Decided to just go for it, since the only other possibility I could think of was >!FRISK!<. Got lucky this time)

Current Streak: 10,8,4,"['arose', 'tulip', 'chink', 'brisk']",brisk,22

I regret that you feel you have been lied to. I shared this because I was happy to have beaten the odds. It is a nice change to the times when I only get it on the last try or even fail completely. 

BTW, if you input the first two words on Wordle Helper, you will see that most of the 129 potentials have two identical letters in them. Since I only had one letter at the time, I wanted to try one with no repeating letters to increase my chance of hitting more letters, and >!GAWKY!< looked good in that regard ;-) .,8,3,"['arise', 'lunch', 'gawky']",gawky,29
The fact that you already had it by Guess 2 but chose to do &gt
Test other letters. It’s easier for me to guess the word if I know 4 letters than 2. Or if I know that certain letters aren’t in the word.,8,4,"['shake', 'route', 'filmy', 'dodge']",dodge,31

You got the >!Es properly placed on the third word, and found the remaining vowel on your next play, so going right to that word playing hard mode would probably have yielded good results for you. Strategic stock second words can be overrated – except of course when the first word returns all black letters.!<,8,5,"['deuce', 'sting', 'evade', 'emote', 'elope']",elope,32

>	 Not sure what you mean.  

FOUND is a legal second guess after TULIP in hard mode, but it isn’t the *only* legal guess. Per Scoredle, TULIP only narrows the field to 512.  

If you want Hard, find a path from TULIP to FOUND such that: 

-	every step is hard mode compliant 
-	according to Scoredle, FOUND is the *only* hard mode compliant alternative after the penultimate guess

For example, if the target word were BLEST (instead of FOUND), and the first guess were TULIP, here’s a four-step path:

Scoredle 4/6  

12,972  
🟨⬛🟨⬛⬛ >!TULIP!< (158)  
🟨⬛🟨⬛⬛ >!LOTTO!< (39)  
🟨⬛🟨🟨⬛ >!SALTY!< (1)  
🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩 >!BLEST!<  

With a moment’s thought, I am sure you will find a three-step path, even though TULIP is the mandatory first guess.,8,4,"['tulip', 'lotto', 'salty', 'blest']",blest,41

Some combination of skill and luck. 

Almost always start with the same 2 words. 

My third guess used 3 letters from my first word and got 1 yellow - which was great. That meant that the other 2 letters had to be in the answer (along with 1 of those 3 letters).

My fourth guess used those 2 letters and only got 1 green and 1 yellow - so those 2 letters were in and the other letters were out. 

That gave me the >!N!< (looking good for the last letter, the >!A!< (either first or fourth), either the >!R or I!< and one out of >!L, O or U!<.

Couldn’t find a word ending in >!AN!< so I worked on >!A_ _ _ N!<.  I tried the vowels first and found >!AXION!< (didn’t think of the double letter and knew >!AVIAN!< was a word but not >!AVION!<.  At that point I usually go with the first word I think of because it would be worse to try something else and have it turn out to be the first word I thought of.,8,5,"['train', 'louse', 'strip', 'eaten', 'axion']",axion,43

You must use the letters you found in subsequent guesses, and (if green), in the same spots.

The place you run into trouble is if you have a prefix or suffix with a lot of answers and you want to burn a word to narrow things down faster.,8,3,"['stole', 'ample', 'maple']",maple,49

I don't play on hard mode by default but I normally follow the hard mode rules. That is until situations like these come up and I only have 3 guesses for 8 possibilities with only one letter missing! So it's basically risk/luck vs strategy. I know how my luck goes, so I chose strategy LOL. Also in hindsight I realize there were much better words I could have used for the 4th word but it happily worked out!
